fields.description:
It would be convenient to allow for the download of the diff file during a pull request.

By this I mean, it would be nice to have a button that when clicked, would download a file summarizing the diff that could be opening in standard diff tools locally to further examine without having to be online/connected to Stash. 
This could help during very large pull requests where one could review the PR offline, recording their comments locally, then "upload" all their comments when they get back to the office.

It would also allow those who want to use their own diff tool to easily download and open the diff locally. 

Code Collaborator provides this functionality as documented here: http://support.smartbear.com/viewarticle/20126/
fields.summary: Allow for download of diff for use in external diff tools

fields.description: Color coding diffs in pull requests is fantastic. Kudos. What would make it even better is if you could associate a preferred color scheme with your profile so that you could the pull requests with your preferred color scheme. This would also be helpful for those that may have vision issues that are lessened (or worsened) by particular color schemes.
fields.summary: Add the ability to choose the color scheme for the color coding in pull requests

fields.description:
_emphasized text_In relation to JRA-28941;

I understand that there are limitations to logging based on log4j and in Tomcat but it is a pain for an Administrator, and for Atlassian support engineers to work with massive logfiles. Stash should ship with a logging system which has log rotation enabled by default for more than just instance restarts.
fields.summary: Ship Stash with defaults that enable Tomcat log rotation

fields.description: If i have release/v1 branch , and i want to merge hotfix in master(production), pull request in master preffer to me only automerge in develop but not in release/v1, it would be greate if stash can detect release branch and automerge in it
fields.summary: Pull request in master(production branch) should be automerged in release/branch if it's exists

fields.description: It would be nice if Stash raised an event when a BuildStatus is published. This allows plugins like workzone to integrate more cleanly with Stash.
fields.summary: Raise an event when a build status is published
Javadoc for PermissionService should be more clear about anonymous user handling

fields.description: Some browsers like Chrome provides great find/search capability. Unfortunately Stash hijacks control/command-F to hook into its own find. Some of us prefer Chrome's find. Please provide a mechanism to disable Stash's find or reassign it to another key.

fields.description: When viewing a pull request's diff, or just browsing a repository's source, using control/command-F seems to have inconsistent case sensitivity (sometime search is case sensitive, sometimes it's not).

fields.description:
It's particularly hard to view and scroll through diffs.

While it allows you to jerk left and right a little, can't even scroll to bottom to use the left/right scrollbar.

This may be very far off, but just something to keep in back of minds; Jira has a mobile client (though it's pretty useless other than viewing content) and serious code reviews you should probably have a laptop/desktop.

iOS 7&8 safari & chrome
Some related tickets include:
STASH-2723 Add User interface nonfunctional without mouseover (e.g. on iPad)
STASH-6864 Unable to submit comments on mobile site 
BAM-6519 Add mobile version of Bamboo pages

fields.description:
When browsing a repository hierarchy, Stash has this behavior where it automatically navigates down if there's only on folder. Example:
dir1 / dir2 / dir3

If I navigate to dir1, Stash automatically redirects to dir2 then dir3. The problem is that if I press the browser back button to go to dir2, it navigates down automatically to dir3, thus I'm forever stuck in dir3.
fields.summary: Browser back button doesn't work due to auto navigate
Stash Find Repo Name from  Repo ID

fields.description: * FEATURE REQUEST:  Finally, one more request (a simple one):  When review comments are unable to be viewed inline with the code due to the diff being unable to determine the correct line, please show them anyway, with a note at the top of the comment saying "Location is approximate".    Currently the tool hides them, and, as far as I can tell, the only way to see them is in the overview tab--which can get quite busy for a big review.  If the entire file was deleted, show the comments at the top of the (blank) file.
fields.summary: Add ability to view comments even if the file was deleted or code removed

fields.description:
USER STORY: The moderator sometimes needs to see exactly what the original reviewers saw.  This basically just ignores any new changes since the bookmark change set.  Again, this can kind-of be done in Stash today.  I do so by selecting the tagged change set and then diff with develop.  However, new changes on develop (from other feature branches) end up being displayed. 

 * FEATURE REQUEST:  Ability to view the exact state of code at the bookmark.  Seems like this should diff the tagged change set to the develop branch, but carefully select the change set on the develop branch to avoid showing changes after the latest merge.
fields.summary: Ability during pull requests to see the original code reviewed

fields.description:
User story: This can kind-of be done in Stash by selecting the tagged changeset and the feature branch.  However, there are two problems with this:  (1) The comments from the review are not displayed inline, and (2) Merges from develop into the feature branch are displayed--making it very difficult to see the review changes only.

 * FEATURE REQUEST:  Ability to view changes since the formal review bookmark, WITHOUT merges from develop, and WITH review comments and tasks.  The moderator can then quickly see that the requested changes were made to the code for each task.
fields.summary: Add ability to set commit range in the diff view of the pull request

fields.description:
Currently Stash has two views into pull requests:
* per repository showing open | merged | declined pull requests
* per user showing reviewing | created pull requests

As somebody overseeing a number of stash projects it would be useful to make the first view available at the project level, or even across stash as a whole.  This would allow me to see what changes are being held up and allow me to chase up reviewers or add additional ones to ease the situation.  Without this roll up I'm left with browsing to each repository one at a time which is time consuming and a little frustrating given that the information is all there :)
fields.summary: Ability to view all open pull requests across a project or across all projects

fields.description:
We have a Stash instance running version 3.6.1 (Java jdk1.8.0_31) on RHEL 6.6 but when trying to upgrade to Stash version 3.7.1 using the package binary (atlassian-stash-3.7.1-x64.bin) the installation script now fails to recognise our STASH_INSTALL and STASH_HOME as two separate parent directories and as a consequence refuse to continue with the upgrade process.

We are using the following directory structure:
STASH_INSTALL = /opt/stash
STASH_HOME = /opt/stash-data

It seems the install script fails to read the "-data" possibly due to the - and thus sees the two directories as the same.
Worth to mention is that we have successfully upgraded the Stash instance in the past without this issue so it seems down to the latest changes to the installation process.

---
Starting Installer ...

This will install Stash 3.7.1 on your computer.
OK [o, Enter], Cancel [c]

Please choose one of the following:
Install a new Stash instance [1, Enter], Upgrade an existing Stash instance [2]
2
Where should Stash be installed?

[/opt/atlassian/stash/3.7.1]
/opt/stash
Default location for Stash home directory

The location for Stash data.
Please provide the location of your existing Stash home directory, where
your repositories, plugins, and other data are stored.

Be sure to STOP your current Stash instance and create a backup before
proceeding.
[/var/atlassian/application-data/stash]
/opt/stash-data
The installation directory cannot be a parent of the home directory. Please choose another location.
Default location for Stash home directory

The location for Stash data.
Please provide the location of your existing Stash home directory, where
your repositories, plugins, and other data are stored.

Be sure to STOP your current Stash instance and create a backup before
proceeding.
[/opt/stash-data]
^C
---
fields.summary: Incorrect nested home directory detection in installer

fields.description:
When you are merging to a branch which is off of a parent branch and you have "Enable automatic merging" turned on Stash (very helpfully) does a merge to the parent branch as well when the pull request is merged.

If the reason you are merging a pull request is to pull a feature ALREADY merged onto the parent branch then the automatic merge to the parent branch is at best a waste of time (creates a no-op merge commit on the parent branch) and at worse creates a meaningless confllct.

If there was a checkbox/button on the Merge dialog "Disable merge" next to the parent branch then in this use case the empty commit on the parent branch could be avoided.
fields.summary: Enable temporary "automatic merging" disablement

fields.description:
In our Stash install, we have two projects (call them ProjectA and ProjectB), each of which has one repo, call it SomeRepo.

These two repositories are related, in the sense that they share the majority of their history, and thus have something in the order of >100K identical commit and object SHAs.

When someone in ProjectB/SomeRepo mentions a commit SHA identifier, Stash automatically creates a link, but for some reason that link always goes to ProjectA/SomeRepo (if that commit exists). This in turn yields to a lot of confusion, especially because ProjectA/SomeRepo has very tight permissions and most of our users don't have access to it.

The reason we have both of these is that we use ProjectA as a testing ground for hooks/etc, and then eventually enable them in ProjectB.

I don't see why Stash would ever link outside the current project if the current project also has that SHA.
fields.summary: Mentioning a commit SHA creates a link to a wrong repository

fields.description:

This can be difficult to read from the command line and can cause confusion over what's actually being asked, so users think this step is prompting for a backup path instead of the home directory.

Suggest we move this prompt to a separate step earlier in the script.
fields.summary: Create a separate step in the Stash installer script for backups

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is a known compatibility issue that prevents the user management synchronisation between JIRA 6.4 and Stash 3.4.3+. 

This will only affect you if you use JIRA to manage your Stash users. The bug in JIRA is being tracked on [JRA-42566|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42566].


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up Stash 3.4.3+ with JIRA 6.4 configured as its User Management Server. To perform that, please refer to [Connecting Stash to JIRA for user management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Connecting+Stash+to+JIRA+for+user+management]
# Perform Synchronisation

h3. Expected Results

Synchronisation should work just fine.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-stash.log}} file:
{noformat}
ERROR [clusterScheduler_Worker-4]  c.a.c.d.DbCachingDirectoryPoller Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 229377 ].
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: Error from Crowd server propagated to here via REST API (check the Crowd server logs for details): Class type for return values ('interface com.atlassian.crowd.model.group.GroupWithAttributes') is not 'String' or 'Group'
	at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.RestCrowdClient.handleCommonExceptions(RestCrowdClient.java:1501) ~[crowd-integration-client-rest-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.RestCrowdClient.searchGroupsWithAttributes(RestCrowdClient.java:574) ~[crowd-integration-client-rest-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.RemoteCrowdDirectory.searchGroups(RemoteCrowdDirectory.java:547) ~[crowd-remote-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.RemoteDirectoryCacheRefresher.findAllRemoteGroups(RemoteDirectoryCacheRefresher.java:80) ~[crowd-ldap-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.RemoteDirectoryCacheRefresher.synchroniseAllGroups(RemoteDirectoryCacheRefresher.java:109) ~[crowd-ldap-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:91) ~[crowd-ldap-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher.java:67) ~[crowd-ldap-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:1122) ~[crowd-core-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:76) ~[crowd-core-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller.pollChanges(DbCachingDirectoryPoller.java:50) ~[crowd-core-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerJobRunner.runJob(DirectoryPollerJobRunner.java:93) [crowd-core-2.8.1-m3.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:153) [atlassian-scheduler-core-1.5.0.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:118) [atlassian-scheduler-core-1.5.0.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:97) [atlassian-scheduler-core-1.5.0.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.quartz2.Quartz2Job.execute(Quartz2Job.java:32) [atlassian-scheduler-quartz2-1.5.0.jar:na]
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:202) [quartz-2.2.1.jar:na]

Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.CrowdRestException: Class type for return values ('interface com.atlassian.crowd.model.group.GroupWithAttributes') is not 'String' or 'Group'

{noformat}
 

h3.Solution / Workaround

This is a bug in JIRA 6.4 and is fixed in JIRA 6.4.1.  The preferred solution is to upgrade to JIRA 6.4.1.  

If upgrading JIRA is not possible, Stash 3.7.2 and 3.8.0 (but not 3.9.1+) contain a workaround and may be used with JIRA 6.4 as a Crowd Server.
fields.summary: JIRA 6.4 as a Crowd Server does not work with Stash 3.4.3 or higher

fields.description:
Starting from Stash 3.7.0, {{PullRequestMergedEvent}} is no longer raised asynchronously. Instead, if it raised directly on the merging thread. This has 2 very important consequences:
# Any database operations performed by listeners are now performed _in the read-only transaction used by the merging thread_ and are rolled back when the merge call completes
# Operations performed by event listeners happen in _user time_ and block the merge request from returning until they are complete
fields.summary: PullRequestMergedEvent is no longer asynchronous

fields.description:
Basically we're looking for a solution to this question: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/13418077/with-stash-automatic-merge-how-can-i-avoid-an-automatic-merge at the pull-request level in Stash.

When doing a pull-request with automatic merging we want to say "do not auto-merge".  The pull-request would then merge to the target branch normally but then do an "ours" merge down the "auto-merge cascade" so that subsequently the change would not be merged down.

Alternatively, potentially allow a cherry-pick/interactive merge for when there are commits that you may not want merged.
fields.summary: Support pull-requests with automatic merging having pull-requests without automatic merging

fields.description:
On v3.8.0-m5 on https://stash.atlassian.com/ :

I have a PR open. There's a comment on a line in a file, which someone made on the current version in the diff view.

Given: My diff hunk with the comment on it has another diff hunk just above it in the file

When: I view the comment in the Overview / Activity stream, and click the zigzag line above the fragment to show more surrounding context lines

Then: I get different results from looking at the same section of code in the Diff view.

(It's definitely the same comment in both views - comment ID 170183; and the comment was made on the current version.)

- _Screen Shot - unified diff_, and _Screen Shot - side-by-side diff_: - these show the actual change and comment correctly. Note there are more hunks of changes right above the hunk that contains the review comment - e.g. notice the {{TODO CRA-549}} comment.

- _Screen Shot - Activity view_ - shows the single diff hunk containing the comment. This is probably OK.

- _Screen Shot - Activity view expanded_ - after clicking the zigzag lines to expand the surrounding context. It's showing the original pre-PR code above the diff hunk. *I think this is wrong, and very misleading* - it doesn't match the current version of the code; it looks as if the hunk is being shown in context, but there's actually another change in this PR affecting those lines, as shown in the diff view, and it's not visible in Activity. E.g. notice the lines with the {{TODO CRA-549}} comment are not visible, etc.

Since I can directly respond to comments in Activity view, it's really important that Activity view's surrounding context should show the current version of the code, i.e. it should show any other hunks affecting those lines. Otherwise I may be making decisions based on incorrect information.
fields.summary: Overview/Activity for a PR shows incorrect surrounding context code when clicking to show more around a diff hunk that's near another hunk

fields.description:
STASH-3782 added support for rendering fenced code blocks in 3.6.0, but seemingly only for "comments, READMEs and pull request descriptions". Any other *.md file is still sortof rendered, but lacks syntax highlighting in fenced blocks.

All *.md files should be rendered the same way as README.md.
fields.summary: README.md files are rendered differently from other *.md files

fields.description:
Commit screen

When tags are on merged commits via Pull Requests, the tag does not display properly. Its almost 'underneath' the commit message.

Screenshot attached
fields.summary: Tag display on commits list

fields.description:
There is an issue creating an Application Link with JIRA from Stash, which manifests itself by not showing branch/commit info in JIRA. 

I'm getting the following symptoms:
* Both in Stash and in JIRA the Application link seems healthy.
  ** the experimental AppLinks UI shows access level 4 set in both directions on both servers, and the arrows are green
* The branch info is not showing up in JIRA.
* JIRA can create branches in Stash just fine.

*If you create the Application Link from JIRA's admin UI however, everything works as expected.*
fields.summary: Application Link from Stash to JIRA is not working as expected

fields.description: Allow stash to use one of the many non-version-specific JRE locations on Linux if it can find them (e.g /etc/alternatives/jre, or /usr/lib/jvm/jre, etc) so that JAVA_HOME is updated to the newest version of Java upon upgrade.
fields.summary: Allow Stash to use non-version-specific JRE locations on Linux

fields.description:
Topic branches come and go, generally disappearing after a single pull request.  But release branches can have many pull requests before it is EOL'd.

The PR option to delete the source branch has already bitten us multiple times when we merge from release/* into master.

Suggestion: Disable the option to delete the source branch for PRs that come from a branch matching the Release branch prefix declared in the Branching Model.

Also, having an audit message for branch deletion would make recovery faster.
fields.summary: Protect Release branches from accidental deletion

fields.description: I would be nice to have Readme.md for a project.
fields.summary: Readme.md for a project in stash

fields.description:
Dear Stash,

Could you please give us a mechanism for identifying the source and destination of pull requests . We currently use gitflow and therefore have pull requests into develop,release and master branches. The testing that we do for the pull requests into each branch is different and runs on different environments. Not having a way to figure out the source/destination is a very painful step in our CI process.

We would really appreciate if you could provide a mechanism to figure out the source and destination branch of pull requests
fields.summary: Identify source and destination branch for pull requests

fields.description:
Pull requests along with build integration steps work great in Stash. However, currently a pull requests visibility is only in the repository where it is created. 

In our current project, we have multiple repositories and there are times when some of the repositories move together. The number of repos that move together is dependent upon the feature being worked upon and it sometimes is an overhead keeping track of pull request across projects that need to be approved at the same time.

An example is that we have a JAVA API , a monitoring codebase and database modules. For a feature that requires changes in all the codebase , we want a mechanism of saying that the pull requests across the 3 repositories can only be merged only when all the 3 pull requests are in merge-ready state(review done, all build and tests pass, no merge conflicts etc)
fields.summary: Orchestrate pull requests "merge-ready" state across multiple repositories

fields.description:
Hi

I am using the atom editor for my stash project and write markdown pages with the help of the atom markdown preview plugin (https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview). Unfortunately, the markdown support from stash is missing some features. Mostly in the area of alignment.

E.g when having the following markdown list:

1._first
2._second

___description of second


(underscore == space) The 'description of second' is not align with 'first' and 'second'. Moreover, syntax highlighting code is missing.

Summarised: Is it possible to support Github flavoured markdown in stash? Would ease a lot because many tools support it.
fields.summary: Markdown Improvements (support of Github flavoured markdown)

fields.description:
*Original report:*
{quote}
Hi, I'm trying to figure out how to sync upstream changes into a downstream fork. I have automatic fork synchronization disabled.

According to the documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Keeping+forks+synchronized), there should be a manual synchronize button in three places:

1. The Source tab
2. The Commits tab
3. Under Settings -> Fork syncing

I'm not seeing it in any of those places.
{quote}

*Actual behaviour:*
{quote}
The "Manual Syncing" option only comes up when the automatic fork syncing is enabled _and_ if upstream and your fork have diverged, so that each has changes that are not in the other.

That being said, the manual syncing will only come up in case the automatic syncing encounters that situation. 

To reproduce, say:
- The auto-syncing is turned off
- You change locally a certain line of a file in the master branch of your upstream and push this change to Stash
- You change locally the same line of the same file on the master branch of the fork and push the change to Stash
- You turn on the auto syncing and the manual option will come up

As described on the documentation, Stash makes any fast-forward change where there is no need to merge work and there is no risk of losing changes. The manual syncing comes into picture to add this extra security layer.
{quote}
fields.summary: Keeping forks synchronized doc needs to clarify manual sync

fields.description: One page that allows administrators to see all users in Stash and their permissions with a number of how many users are counted against the Stash license. When an administrator clicks on a user all permissions granted to this user are shown.
fields.summary: User Permissions View

fields.description: On the commits page there is a comment icon followed by number of comments, it would be nice to see a quick view of what the comment is when you hover. The functionality is already there for builds (when you hover the (!) icon it displays "# build(s) failed")
fields.summary: Hover comment icon displays comments

fields.description:
Dear Stash Product manager ,

We have moved to using Stash in a big way. All our repositories are now hosted in Stash. While doing so , we are running into a minor issue. 

We have multiple git repositories and some of them move together during releases . We wanted to know if you could add a mechanism for coordinating pull requests across repository. For ex we want pull request 123  in repository A to be only eligible for merge approval if pull request 456 in repository B is eligible as well.
fields.summary: Integrate pull requests across repositories

fields.description:
Repository with size ~500MB, after upgrade to 3.7.1 after a day working raises:
{code}
remote: Counting objects: 256, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (218/218), done.
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedlyiB | 11.04 MiB/s
fatal: early EOF
fatal: index-pack failed
{code}

~on 40%.

git gc --agressive, git fsck --full and git repack -A does not help. Only stash restart has solved this problem.
fields.summary: Stash raise "The remote end hung up unexpectedly" over HTTPS git clone

fields.description:
You'll notice this is similar to STASH-5196 - except that I fundamentally disagree about "fixing" a broken feature by removing it.

I don't care that it's being currently showed to me in rich format - if I want to see how it changed, I actually want to see it.

My full documentation is in the repository, and a merge went bad a while ago. Where? Stash can't tell me.

It'd be nice to have a workaround (how can we blame the raw file?), but the button *should* be there (and work!)
fields.summary: Blame button isn't an option for a markdown .md file in source view and should be

fields.description: When i review the code and I see new Jira reference added in a comment I'd like to be able to quickly preview the jira issue. Now both URLS and issue references (XYZ-123) are not clickable. Neither in the diff nor in the source preview.
fields.summary: JIRA issues links in stash diffs should be clickable

fields.description: As a Stash user, I want to be able to see all of the pull requests that are open where I am blocking on them (not yet reviewed), so I can go do the necessary code reviews.
fields.summary: Create JIRA gadget for pull requests where I need to review

fields.description: As a Stash user, I want to be able to see all of the pull requests that I have open, so I can go hassle the assigned reviewers if needed.
fields.summary: Create JIRA gadget for my open pull requests

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate*
# First of all confirm that Stash is able to provide the producer events by pointing your URL to {{/rest/remote-event-producer/latest/capabilities}}
# This will advertise all the events
# Now disable the plugin "Atlassian Remote Event Producer Plugin" and verify that the events in step 1 above are not showing. This is expected
# Now re-enable the plugin
# Point to the url above

*Expected behavior*
The events should be advertise again after re-enabling the plugin

*Current behavior*
Stash will just show an empty json list of events

*Workaround*
Restart Stash to get the functionalities back
fields.summary: Plugin functionalities lost when they are disabled and re-enabled
Ability to disable Custom Branch option

fields.description: The log files are created with permissions so that only the service user can actually read the files. Since the service user does not have permission to logon interactively, there is no-one that can actually read the log files
fields.summary: Permission on log files are incorrect

fields.description:
When using the 3.7.1 installer to perform an in-place upgrade. The installer fails to correctly perform an upgrade. Specifically:-

- The service it was running under is marked as disabled, not replacement is created
- Stash is not restarted at the end of the install regardless
fields.summary: Installer Does Not Perform Upgrade Correctly

fields.description:
Hi,

We are using GIT Forking workflow for Pull Requests. With the recent upgrade to latest version of 3.7.0, we are seeing some ambiguity in the GIT-Merge-issues-Helper-Dialogue window. Assuming that, the commands provided in the helper dialogue are given wrong way, the sourcerepo,sourcebranch and targetrepo and targetbranch values are reading as opposite way.

Please refer my two attached images, where the sourceref and targetref repos and branches showed in first image and helper dialogue image is attached as second image. The commands suggested in this window are trying to merge sourcebranch to targetbranch and push the merged code (destination branch) directly to destination repo directly. We have enabled another plugin 'PullRequest must Please' plugin to allow everyone to use PR for code pushes.

Let me know if something wrong here or the suggested workaround to fix it on my stash instance.

Appreciate for your quick hep on this.

Regards,
Srinivas
fields.summary: Stash web merge-help dialogue should indicate that it's performing a manual merge

fields.description:
Make the Create/Delete Tag REST API raise an event that can be cancelled -
Customer use case:
Currently we have a custom post-receive-hook that disables tag deletion, and I don't want that to be able to be bypassed from a REST API
fields.summary: Create/Delete Tag REST API's should raise an event that can be cancelled

fields.description:
We have certain cases where write permissions on a branch should be done using SSH keys rather than a user/service account.  Could Stash branch permissions be extended to support SSH keys on top of users and groups?

Thank you,
--Johan
fields.summary: Branch Permissions By SSH Keys

fields.description:
User who is bind with a SSH key can still clone while their account has expired on the Active Directory. However, this user will not able to login to Stash.

Another scenario on the same concept works where the user (bind with the SSH key) is disabled in AD and that user will not be able to clone or login.
fields.summary: Expired user in Active Directory do not stop user from cloning via SSH

fields.description: Markup works as expected however the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Markdown+syntax+guide] states that inline HTML is supposed to be allowed as well.
fields.summary: PR description and comment not rendering in HTML

fields.description:
When I review a pull request, I want to see if added lines are covered by tests.

It would be nice to have an API endpoint where I could POST coverage for the pull request.
fields.summary: Display code coverage in pull request diffs

fields.description:
Hey,

I am sitting in a fairly large instance, 2000+ repos and have noticed that the System Info tab is more or less impossible to access. When accessing it it just hangs saying:
{noformat}The contents of this tab are loading...{noformat}

I have also noticed in my Development instance (which is much smaller) that each repo is represented in the System Info tab and I suspect that the number of repos in the instance is the reason for this tab to hang.

Would it be possible to e.g. page this info in same way so that I can access the other information in this tab?
fields.summary: Accessing System Info in large instance fails

fields.description:
We are using Git Bash (1.9.5.msysgit.0) with PuTTY 0.63 the Python Debug Environment. I have seen many systems hang after resolving the deltas. I have waited up to 15 minutes in the past. The solution was to <Ctrl-C> and run until it worked.

We found several discussion on git clone hang resolutions involving the SSH-2 winadj diagnostic requests.  The previous Stash 2.7.1 had this issue logged: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-3824

We are running Stash 3.3.1 but the forcing of the winadj bug fix resolved the block for me and Logan. I ran 5 out of 5 new clones successfully without any hangs! 

Has the bug resurfaced in 3.3.1?  Perhaps? I will be advising everyone to implement the winadj bug fix for now.
fields.summary: SSH operations hang when using PuTTy or TortoiseGit

fields.description:
Similar to STASH-2981, if a commit hash is used in a git commit message in Stash, this should link to the commit in Stash. 

Currently, it is just being shown as plain-text. See screenshot attached for an example.
fields.summary: Commit Links From Git Commit Messages
hazelcast.group.name/password in distributions is not a placeholder

fields.description: Stash used to allow us to comment on commits... the interface is there, but it seems like it's broken.  After adding the comment, it shows up as blank.  I can't seem to find this in the bug reports.  See attached screenshots
fields.summary: Commenting on a commit seems to be supressed

fields.description:
When a comment on a pull request is created, a mail notification is sent to both the reviewer of the PR and the people mentioned with @ in the comment. That's fine.
But when a comment on a commit is created, there is of course no reviewer but even people mentioned with the @ do not get notified. This is preventing us from making effective code reviews.
As we cannot see why the commenting behaviour is different between a PR and a commit we consider this to be a bug rather than a feature.
(PS: Has this maybe already been fixed in a newer version?)
fields.summary: Commenting on a commit with @ does not send out a notification

fields.description:
After a pull request is merged, we receive the following error:
'/usr/bin/git rev-list --format=%H%x02%P%x02%aN%x02%aE%x02%at%n%B%n%x03END%x04 --no-walk a489ce176fc26d322863e531e6f947df79fb6c02 a489ce176fc26d322863e531e6f947df79fb6c02^@ --' exited with code 141'

The pull request gets closed as merged, but every time the merge commit is accessed via Stash (e.g. commits navigation, branch navigation, pull request creation) the same error will be displayed.

This issue was seen once about a week and a half ago and could not be reproduced.  Several days later (Friday February 27), we had hardware upgraded and had a slight issue restarting the database due to some incorrect permissions, but after successful db restart and Stash restart, we were able to pass sanity testing (create branches, pull requests and merge) and no issues were reported from teams using it.  But today we had to bring Stash down for a minor config change.  A project was previously setup for "squash" merge strategy for pull requests (owned by same team that reported the problem the previous week and a half).  We brought Stash down and deleted one line for the "squash" merge strategy for the one project (they wanted the default of "no-ff").  After restarting, we started our sanity testing in a test project (not the same as the project that we removed the "squash" merge strategy for).  We started getting the error above every time on a pull request merge that had a merge commit created and whenever that merge commit is accessed.  This is happening every time now!

This appears like it could be related to STASH-6972... We have not had a chance to upgrade to 3.6.1..  also i wasn't sure if this was happening every time for the person that reported STASH-6972.  

I also built and installed git 2.3 (this was mentioned in STASH-6972 as working for another team) and restarted with that set as the version for the "atlstash" user.  Still no luck...
fields.summary: Error caused with pull request merge, which occurs everytime the merge commit is accessed

fields.description:
The /rest/branch-permissions/1.0/project/{projectKey}/repos/{repoSlug}/restricted endpoint can be used to create a new branch restriction, but throws an 409 error if a restriction already exists.

To do a insert or update operation, you first need to fetch all the restrictions for the branch, then either create the new branch restriction (if one does not already exist) or update it (if it does).

This requires more complicated code and two API calls where one would do.
fields.summary: POST to /rest/branch-permissions/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repoSlug}/restricted should insert or update

fields.description:
Running the Stash Backup Client triggered an OOME within Stash.  The Stash server performs the database backup itself and has problems when trying to backup up about 1.2GB of data from the {{sta_shared_lob}} table. 

Improve Stash Core on DB backup by limiting databases with huge amount of data
- Idea: Introduce paging when huge amount of data is present.
fields.summary: Database backup can cause OutOfMemoryError for huge database tables

fields.description: A sample use case : A customer have ~6mil records in this table that causes an OOME when using SBC to backup
fields.summary: The table sta_shared_lob doesn't remove old records that may cause clogs

fields.description:
# Open a declined pull request
# Attempt to make a task on a comment
# Attached error shows
# Close the error without refreshing the page
# Task was still created successfully

I recorded the relevant HTTP requests and responses for the task add action:

{code}
XHR finished loading: POST "https://stash.michiganlabs.com/rest/api/latest/tasks".
GET https://stash.michiganlabs.com/rest/api/latest/projects/MUEU/repos/web/pull-requests/10/merge 409 (54035)
XHR finished loading: GET "https://stash.michiganlabs.com/rest/api/latest/projects/MUEU/repos/web/pull-requests/10/merge".
XHR finished loading: POST "https://stash.michiganlabs.com/rest/analytics/1.0/publish/bulk".
{code}

The response for the request that had the 409 error was the message shown in the screenshot:

{code:javascript}
{"errors":[{"context":null,"message":"This pull request has been declined and must be reopened before it can be merged.","exceptionName":"com.atlassian.stash.pull.IllegalPullRequestStateException"}]}
{code}

I have now tried this in Chrome/Safari/Firefox (mac), all with same result.

Upgrading from 3.6.0 to 3.7.1 had no effect.
fields.summary: Error when creating tasks on declined pull requests

fields.description:
As suggested in STASH-2874, the need to have the Stash admin change the properties for all {{plugin.stash-scm-git.pullrequest.merge.strategy*}} options induces an unnecessary burden on the Stash admin and is not scalable.

Since Stash Admins, Project Admins and Repo Admins are not necessarily the same people and because the UI doesn't expose the setting for the preferred pull request merge strategy, teams will be unable to experiment easily with another pull request merge strategy and see if other merge strategies fit better their needs.

Please expose the following settings in the UI:

Per repository configuration (where "KEY" is the project key and "slug" is the repository slug):
{{plugin.stash-scm-git.pullrequest.merge.strategy.KEY.slug}}

Per project configuration:
{{plugin.stash-scm-git.pullrequest.merge.strategy.KEY}}

Optionally, the global configuration could be exposed, too:
{{plugin.stash-scm-git.pullrequest.merge.strategy}}

Initial suggestion was at:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-2874?focusedCommentId=703643&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-703643
fields.summary: Stash should expose the plugin.stash-scm-git.pullrequest.merge.strategy* setting in the UI

fields.description:
This came up during a security audit, I'm not sure that I understand why this issue keeps getting closed when it poses a possible security threat.  Until this issue gets resolved we're going to be blocking ssh access to Stash.  I understand that this may require a complicated fix, but this software isn't necessarily cheap either. 

Weak cipher algorithms:
  3des-cbc
  aes128-cbc
  blowfish-cbc

Weak MAC algorithms:
  hmac-md5
  hmac-md5-96
  hmac-sha1-96
fields.summary: Disable weak SSH Ciphers
Request to add "canMerge": true||false to Pull Request API

fields.description:
In this page, CTRL-F doesn't do anything:
https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/browse/README.md

In any other non .md file, it opens a confluence-specific (not the browser's) search bar, which is what I would expect.

As far as I can tell the problem occurs for any .md files (tested the project README.md and one other .md file in two separate projects).

I refreshed the page where CTRL-F doesn't work, clicked around in it to set the focus on different elements, but to no avail. There is also nothing logged into the console when CTRL-F is pressed.
fields.summary: CTRL+F doesn't open a search bar in .md files

fields.description:
This is because the rescope processor caps the number of both the added and removed commits to 5.

As a result, {{PullRequestRescopeActivity.getAdded().getChangesets()}} and {{PullRequestRescopeActivity.getRemoved().getChangesets()}} will always return at most 5 changesets. (The counts {{PullRequestRescopeActivity.getAdded().getTotal()}} and {{PullRequestRescopeActivity.getRemoved().getTotal()}} are always correct though.)
fields.summary: Email notifications: the message 'and more commits'  is missing when there is more than 5 commits for batched notifications
